0: POLICE have uncovered possibly one of the best insights into the mind of a pot smoker—a hilarious hand-written plan for their day. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Officers in Murdoch, Western Australia, uncovered the list as they raided a Perth home looking for clues about a suspected burglary. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR It’s not clear if the officers found any evidence to press charges during the raid but did find a detailed plan of the resident’s intentions to get stoned. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Are ur Saturdays hectic like this!!! To do list located at search warrant in Cooby. #MurdochLPT3 pic.twitter.com/KdpMbdEYMq — Murdoch Police (@MurdochPol) April 30, 2015 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The list, called “Things to do Saturday”, included such things as ‘go to bus stop’ and ‘go get lunch (chips and gravy).’ NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The tweet captioned ‘Are ur Saturdays hectic like this!!!!” prompted a swift response on social media. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “At least being stoned at home is less of a social nuisance than going out and getting trashed,” one Twitter user wrote. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “This is proof stoners are dangerous, he should definitely be arrested,” another added. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Murdoch Police came under fire from some local residents.
